intro: Triadenum japonicum var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved triadenum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
